website_summaries.verdict: Keeps debris out of your boots in the brush, pants clean in the mud, and legs dry in the snow.
pros: Durable for long hiking, camping, or hunting trips
Will keep your legs nice and warm in the rain
cons: The tops of these gaiters have a chord for tightening instead of a buckle, which tends to be a bit more secure

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive gator for hiking
customer_reviews.text: I bought this primarily for going backpacking in the wilderness to keep out: 1. Rain/moisture 2. Ticks 3. Dirt For Rain and Dirt, this worked perfectly well: my legs stayed dry, and at the end of the day, I was not covered in dust. I did not get to test it with ticks -- and let's keep it that way :) If you found this review helpful, please hit the "Yes" button to encourage me to write more. Thank you!
customer_reviews.author: Photographer | Tech Pro | Outdoor EnthusiastTop Contributor: Photography

customer_reviews.title: Great for snow hiking
customer_reviews.text: I have used these a couple times to hike in the deep snow and they shed great! Combined with waterproof hiking boots, I'm staying toasty dry. They are also quiet and easy to put on and stay in place. Photo shows them in action on the trail
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca K. Pearman

customer_reviews.title: I got a size small and they fit great.
customer_reviews.text: I just wore these for a VERY muddy trail run that included a walk through creek crossing. There was no chance for dry feet but they kept my ankles and calves warm and dry. See photo attached. The price was right for me and they did the trick! I got a size small and they fit great.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Low quality, low durability.  Made in china.
customer_reviews.text: 1. Do yourself a favor-- for the same price, you can find gaiters which have a velcro or other form of tightening strap at the top. Buy those instead. This product only has a low quality elastic string to close the top of the gaiters. Not only does it not close the top completely, but it is clear the elastic string will wear out quickly. 2. The fabric on these is simply one layer of woven nylon. It does not seem very durable. There are other products which seem to offer more than one layer of fabric. Go with a different product-- there are superior products at the same price (or even lower price). Don't buy these.
customer_reviews.author: P. Meaney

customer_reviews.title: No need for snowboots!
customer_reviews.text: These have held up through some serious abuse! After misplacing an old pair of gators, I bought these because of the price and prime delivery. They utilize velcro instead of a zipper which I feel makes for a better fit and quicker to fasten. They are seem taped, double stitched and have gone through some strenuous backpacking and snowshoeing. I posted some pics of the minimal wear and tear after two solid months of heavy use. I have submerged my entire legs under feet of snow and under slush to remain perfectly dry. All of which was while wearing a low cut wp hiking shoe!!!
customer_reviews.author: Josh D

customer_reviews.title: made in China too small
customer_reviews.text: These things run really small, i bought a medium and had to give them to my wife, I than bought a large and gave those to my wife also,,,TOO SMALL...I am 5ft, 8in and weigh about 175 , iI live in the Upper Peninsula of Michigan and I wanted to wear these for winter use with pack boots and insulated under wear under my jeans,,,, these things would not go around my legs..At fifteen dollars ...not worth returning...dont think I will order extra large.
customer_reviews.author: babber

customer_reviews.title: Great Item
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these for my son who works outdoors and prefers not to wear full rain pants. I also bought a pair for myself for using during my yard work. When I use my string trimmer, my pant legs would get nasty grass stains. These totally stop that from happening now. When I'm done trimming, I simply use a whisk broom to brush these off, remove them then wipe off the straps and they're nice and ready for the next time I need them. It's a great item and I'd recommend them to anyone who does lawn work or works in the rain.
customer_reviews.author: moonslight, a Believer

customer_reviews.title: The quality of product is excellent, strap for going under the shoe is adjustable ...
customer_reviews.text: I'm 5'3'' and 115lbs female with a size 7 shoe and ordered the small in black (although it's more of a charcoal grey, which I love) and it fits *almost perfectly! The quality of product is excellent, strap for going under the shoe is adjustable and durable- my only complaint, the ties around the calf don't go in that far, so I can't snugly secure it around my upper calf. However, because the quality of material is so nice, it doesn't seem to be falling and scrunching down around my ankle and stands up on it's own. For the price, i'd totally recommend them still though!
customer_reviews.author: Monica Walker

customer_reviews.title: Way to small for a size 13 hunting boot. ...
customer_reviews.text: Way to small for a size 13 hunting boot. Maybe the company should have some on try on a pair of Hunting boots and get the measurements right. I would buy them again because I had a pair long time ago and put them through the ringer everyday of winter for about 6 years before they wore out. Oh yea, made in USA. (old ones). China is Cheaply made.
customer_reviews.author: LABiker

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfectly for 500 meters, then the Velcro would ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked perfectly for 500 meters, then the Velcro would not stay fastened which created a hiking hazard and the were gaiters pointless for water protection. Look elsewhere.
customer_reviews.author: Cory Sipes

customer_reviews.title: Just buy them. They are a steal.
customer_reviews.text: Just wore these for the first time today on a winter hike in the Adirondack today. There was a foot of snow on the ground, and I wore them over some military grade khakis and Merrill ankle level hiking boots. They worked extremely well, and kept the snow off of me. They also added a bit of warmth, which I didn't expect, but didn't mind at all. For the price, they are a steal. The material is water repellent and I will always use them for harsher conditions.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan Rago

customer_reviews.title: Easy to put on and stays put once on
customer_reviews.text: Could have found a cheaper gaiter on Amazon, but these offered sizing options with detailed description. They seem solidly built, fit as promised, and are relatively easy to put on. I use them for slogging through dense, tick-infested brush and they stay up and perform the job. I hope they last 30 years like the old, cheap pair they replaced.
customer_reviews.author: PrairieFire

customer_reviews.title: They do what they are suppose to do
customer_reviews.text: The price point is good for these leg protectors. They are well crafted and sturdy. I am not excited over the strap that goes under the foot arch of the boots. It is a synthetic strap material covered with a plastic like coating. The straps feel secure and does a good job holding the protectors in place but I wonder as to strap durability over time. Reading the reviews give me a sense they will hold up OK. Overall the leggings provide decent protection for walking in the woods where ticks, bugs, and grasses are an issue. These leggings keep my socks and shoes clear of annoying small sticker weeds, small rocks, and insects. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Peter DP

customer_reviews.title: Bought a second pair!
customer_reviews.text: Ordered a pair in 2018, to treat with permethrin for tick-defense in the north woods of MN. I retreat with diluted permethrin every year or so. Works great! Ticks 'hot foot' off, on treated surfases. These are well made, easy on & off, great value, and bonus they work great for keeping mud etc off of pants, when hiking in the muck. Like them so much, ordered another smaller pair for my wife. Same quality, work just as well.
customer_reviews.author: T. Kadrie

customer_reviews.title: Wish it fitted properly over my boots!
customer_reviews.text: I like this product in general. Seems to be well made and of good materials. Used it right away. Does not work well wearing my rubber boots. Was only able to close the top and bottom. I bought it to seal my rubber boots' top to stop debris from falling into my boots, when I tucked my pant's bottoms into the boots to protect them from staining and fraying. It did that with difficulty, but I made it work. It would have been better if they were made somewhat wider. That said, I shall be using them with my other shoes. Seems to be a good product if you are wearing shoes.
customer_reviews.author: cyman

customer_reviews.title: Pleased with purchase, protected me from chiggers in the tall grass.
customer_reviews.text: Very effective in keeping bugs and debris out of shoe. Sizing will depend on the type of shoe (boot vs. shoe) and the thickness of your pant (jeans vs workout pant). I'm medium build and the medium size works if I am wearing jeans. Customer service excellent, responsive---company reliable, dependable. The cinch on one of the leggings broke, and they resolved the problem immediately. I would buy from them again.
customer_reviews.author: J. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Volcano hiking approved...pumice/ash & snow stayed out of boots!
customer_reviews.text: I needed these for a backpacking trip through Katmai National Park...hiking through pumice/ash and snow. These worked extremely well for me once I figured out how to wear them properly (there IS a R- & L- gator...the velcro strip needs to be on the outside, otherwise you'll undo the velcro while you're walking...a bit annoying, but doesn't effect gator's ability to keep stuff out of your shoe). I really liked the color (as pictured...greenish-yellow), and the fit was perfect for my somewhat athletic/thick calves. And, you can't beat the price!
customer_reviews.author: H. MILLER

customer_reviews.title: These worked great dealing with the Mud in Dolly sods
customer_reviews.text: These worked great dealing with the Mud in Dolly sods. Not too hot, either. I sprayed with permethrin so they'd offer a good barrier for ticks. I liked that they were an extra layer of protection for my pants when we were bushwhacking for a little bit. Not waterproof on the bottom so don't stick your foot in a stream without expecting wet feet. I didn't have much choice when my boot lost traction on the rock I was standing on and I went in like Luke Skywalker in the garbage compactor. I imagine they will also do fantastically well dealing with snow. Looking forward to having the chance to find out.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel Kolansky

customer_reviews.title: so this is perfect! This will keep it all out of his ...
customer_reviews.text: I got these for my husband who is always in the woods. He also does snow removal in the winter months and sometimes not cold enough for his big heavy Carhartt pants, so this is perfect! This will keep it all out of his boots and keep his legs dry. When he is in the woods I thought these would be great for brush too. He is very happy I got these. Already put them to use up in the woods.
customer_reviews.author: jmbilletTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably priced, works really well, would buy again.
customer_reviews.text: These were great, wore these with my Danner Mountain Lights as I hiked through the most strenuous Norway and Iceland hikes in the winter and it kept my feet dry throughout. Guys I went with were jealous that I brought these a long as they thought their high boots were sufficient to keep ice out. Reasonably priced for the function I required, would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Long

customer_reviews.title: All his buddies used to rib him but are amazed at how he remains straw free now
customer_reviews.text: My boy works at a feed store and any straw bale orders ruin his day in a hurry. These work with any shoe/boot and will NOT let any straw into his socks/shoes no matter how much he squats or bends. If you don't wear tall boots, and you work at a feed store with straw, you need these! All his buddies used to rib him but are amazed at how he remains straw free now. They're a hit!
customer_reviews.author: Dissent

customer_reviews.title: Solid for the price. May need repair after hard use.
customer_reviews.text: Fits well and keeps your boots dry. They are easy to put on and comfortable to wear. With some extensive wear the bottom straps that go under your heal tore loose. The strap maintained integrity enough to be sewed back on. The simple stitches they come with are a bit lacking and if you buy them I reccomend reinforcing them with some square stitches. I do reccomend them, as for the most part they are solid enough for moderate use. I tend to be more tough on my gear, that is why I learned how to fix all of it.
customer_reviews.author: Chris W

customer_reviews.title: Good protection
customer_reviews.text: I ordered these for a hike through Volcanoes National Park in Twanda. It was recommended to wear gaiters because of the stinging nettles, and I was really glad that I wore them. Before the trip I sprayed them with Scotchguard. During the trip they protected me from the nettles and also kept me dry from the wet brush. I would recommend these, based on the one day experience I had!
customer_reviews.author: Amanda

customer_reviews.title: Totally exceeded my expectations
customer_reviews.text: I bought these on amazon and they arrived right in time for a backpacking trip this last weekend. The peak we bagged was wet, muddy, slippery and slimey. Not only did they keep dirt out of my boots and dirty the pants, they took a nice mud bath and rinsed off like new. They made this messy peak a pleasant experience. The Velcro held up nicely during the abuse, I just made personal and minor adjustments along the way. I'm very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: DiGsInNYC

customer_reviews.title: First impression
customer_reviews.text: Great quality and fit! I have not used them for the intended purpose yet, but my first impression is that the product will do well. I was a bit confused on sizing until I actually measured and compared my measurements to theirs. I HIGHLY recommend you do this before ordering. I am a woman who wears a size 10 shoe and automatically thought I would need the large. I ordered the medium and it fits perfectly. Remember to measure!!
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: If you have larger calfs, order a size up.
customer_reviews.text: I wear men's size 9 for shoes, and 36-38 for pants. My calfs are pretty thick, and the mediums I ordered fit just *barely* around my calfs. Otherwise they fit well for the rest of my leg. If I were to order again, I'd go the next size up because of my calfs. Quality is great though.
customer_reviews.author: Allen V.

customer_reviews.title: Worked perfect and they really keep the snow out
customer_reviews.text: The original strap is way too short. I hope the manufacturer actually tries them with boots. I went out and bought 1/2 in black elastic and hand sewed them on. Worked perfect and they really keep the snow out. If you have more than 2 feet.....consider staying in. lol
customer_reviews.author: lisa

customer_reviews.title: Finally went snowshoeing and used them.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered to go with a pair of snowshoes. Finally had a late season storm and got out under a full pack in the snow. I had previously worn them on night hikes to keep low branches and bramble from tearing up my shins. These are not what I would call briar proof, but for the weight they are reasonably tough. They fit over both my trail shoes and heavy waterproof boots. I was concerned there would be enough room to close the velcro around the pants and boots, but it was a manageable challenge. As of now I have no complaints and they will be part of my cold weather adventure kit.
customer_reviews.author: TechnoNomadic

customer_reviews.title: Very poor quality hook n loop strap
customer_reviews.text: Upon the second use the hook n loop sole strap fails to stay secure. Very poor quality hook n loop strap. Not recommended and very disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: 6-PAK

customer_reviews.title: Waterproof.......if you have a tight seal on the velcro
customer_reviews.text: Took these into the BWCA to help keep my feet dry. They did, sort of; getting out of a canoe, as long as I was in the deeper water for only 3 seconds or less (and I had the velcro sealed tight) it worked, but not ideal. This year I just got a taller pair of waterproof boots. But for snow or incidental wetness, these would do the job just fine.
customer_reviews.author: AccordionMan

customer_reviews.title: Won’t weed-whack without ‘em!
customer_reviews.text: These things appear to be well made and work/fit just as described. I only wear them when using the string trimmer around our 5 acre property. I spray them with a permethrin emulsion to repel/kill ticks and other creepy crawlers. They are adjustable at the top and vianthe Velcro closure as well. They stay in place and so far have kept the ugly little critters away. Definitely worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: JRO

customer_reviews.title: Great gaiters
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to put on and take off. Have hiked over 20 miles with them on so far and up to a couple miles in thicker brush. They make it easier to hike through the brush as the brush slides over them. One of the best parts for me is that my hiking boots stay tied and laces don't get caught up and come untied. Husband liked them so we bought him a pair too. Had orange color on my Christmas list and now planning to buy a second pair in another color.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good product!
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my early season elk hunt cause of the light rain that blanketed the vegetation which was soaking everything from the knees down. Man it was just the thing we needed, it kept us dry during our hunt. It dried quick too after use, just hung them up in the sun or next to a campfire. Noise was not an issue either.
customer_reviews.author: AS

customer_reviews.title: Dry feet in the rain
customer_reviews.text: These are fabulous for walking in the rain, they are not attractive at all and hard to get used to putting them on correctly but they really do work well so for the rain I would totally suggest these to keep your socks and back of pant leg from getting wet. I would purchase them again to bad they dont come in other colors.
customer_reviews.author: Gammy

customer_reviews.title: Strap broke on my first use.
customer_reviews.text: Plastic buckle piece broke the first time I used these in Yosemite. Luckily I had a spare carabineer that I was able to thread through the strap to hold it closed and around my boot, but really expected these to be more durable.
customer_reviews.author: Kait

customer_reviews.title: They where great keeping 3+ feet of snow out of my boots ...
customer_reviews.text: Got 2 pair of these for a friend and myself when we went to the white mountains in new Hampshire. They where great keeping 3+ feet of snow out of my boots all day every day for about 11 days and nights. Just make sure your straps are tight and your good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Purchased these on impulse for a hike, for how ...
customer_reviews.text: Purchased these on impulse for a hike, for how cheap they were I was only expecting to get a couple wears out of it before having to replace them. Nope! They're still going strong! I've machine washed them 3 times now and they're still going strong!
customer_reviews.author: brena

customer_reviews.title: Gators are heavier than name brand
customer_reviews.text: These are replacing a name brand. Straight out of the box, I am happy. The material is way heavier than my other gators. Construction seems well made. The calf adjustment is great as I have big calves and will accommodate any boot or shoe worn. As I use these, I will update my review. At present I can't wait to see how they work. I recommend you check them out
customer_reviews.author: 8789sm

customer_reviews.title: Took these for a successful Mt. Whitney summit. ...
customer_reviews.text: Took these for a successful Mt. Whitney summit. Kept rocks, water, and snow out of my boots. No issue using crampons with these on either. Be sure to check the strap that goes underneath your boot periodically. The strap that goes underneath my boots took a beating rendering the gators unusable after my trip. With that being said, these gators are worth every penny.
customer_reviews.author: sneakyMOBA

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: My wife and I used this together with waterproof hiking boots on extremely muddy trails that we walked to get to a remote village in Guatemala for several hours. Worked perfectly. At times the Velcro would detach but that's understandable because of the excess of mud. We didn't encounter any snakes but I'm sure it would have protected our legs from them. Comfortable to use, good quality.
customer_reviews.author: Adrián Z. R.

customer_reviews.title: They fit great. I love how tall they are
customer_reviews.text: I purchased these for my upcoming trek to Everest base camp. In the meantime I've used them for cross country skiing, snowbike riding, winter trail running, & even out shoveling all the crazy snow we've had this winter. They fit great. I love how tall they are. They are easy to take on & off. I've used with multiple shoes. Great price. Great product.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremi Broadhurst

customer_reviews.title: They were also great for outdoor hiking
customer_reviews.text: These were a solid pair of gaiters that I used around the house and yard. They were also great for outdoor hiking. They are not, however, designed to fit over large mountaineering boots. This is the only reason im giving 3 stars, because it was my main reason for purchase. I took them on a trip and the clasp was just a little too short. Other than that, they worked great and I recommend them.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Bender

customer_reviews.title: Very Handy to Have When it Snows, or When You Snowshoe/Hike!
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 2 pair--one for my boyfriend, who does more snowshoeing than I, and a pair for myself. I was glad I finally used my pair snow blowing my driveway, since it kept the bottom legs of my jeans dry. It does take some getting used to putting them on and fastening the velcro, but once they are on, I don't have to think about getting snow and moisture on my clothes.
customer_reviews.author: April M. Love

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for 3/4 melted snow scrambles / hikes
customer_reviews.text: I love these bad boys. I went up to Alberta to to a few scrambles and was just expecting scree, not snow patches everywhere. These gators killed it and kept me fairly warm which I wasn't expecting either. I TORE up the bottom plastic on the bottom of the shoe strap though, I'm not sure if that's normal or not. I think I could probably get 2-3 more trips out of them until I am only relying on the inside material. They really saved my life so I am a happy camper :)
customer_reviews.author: LianaCash

customer_reviews.title: Not the fanciest but definitly fit the bill!
customer_reviews.text: Picked up as a last minute purchase to shield from mud and water on a long bike ride. These are not cycling Gaiters by any means but they helped keep unwanted mud and water out of the top of my shoe. Granted, it rained a lot on this bike ride and water found its way into my shoes anyway but not through these gaiters.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew Ford

customer_reviews.title: Surprisingly durable.
customer_reviews.text: I wore these while climbing Kilimanjaro and I was amazed by how durable they were. I for sure thought the strap under the shoe would rip off at any moment or the fabric itself would tear but it didn't! They got super dirty and muddy yet left the lower part of my leg dry and clean. They also keeps all the rocks and mud out of my boots. For the price I was very impressed!
customer_reviews.author: maria kelakios

customer_reviews.title: Great Color and Fit
customer_reviews.text: Love the color and the fit is perfect. Beware to measure your calf for the appropriate size as a person with large calf muscles might have a difficult time with it fitting. I constantly get compliments on these gators, and the price is phenomenal for the product you receive.
customer_reviews.author: Denise M Hartzell

customer_reviews.title: dirty and challenging
customer_reviews.text: Used these on a trek at 14000 feet to get to the silver back mountain gorillas. The climbing was very wet, slippery, dirty and challenging. They worked great and were donated to the lodge on my departure so someone that comes less prepared then myself can save their pants and selves from insect bites and waterlogged. Great color for gray hiking pants to match. Loved them!
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Carlson

customer_reviews.title: Lightweight, flexible, great for running
customer_reviews.text: I have to say I am massively impressed with these. Was looking for a cheap gaiter to get me started last season, these are a big bang for the price. Incredibly lightweight, very flexible, I have done quite a few trail runs in these comfortably. They stay put, keep the snow and wind out, definitely recommend. Not to mention the color is super fun :)
customer_reviews.author: Felicity Russell

customer_reviews.title: These aren't going to last for years of routine use ...
customer_reviews.text: These aren't going to last for years of routine use but they worked very well in knee-high, heavy mud for me. They kept out mud, water and most important, ants from the top of my boots. The edges are a little rough in some places so the quality may not be outstanding long-term or it may be purely cosmetic.
customer_reviews.author: slyesa

customer_reviews.title: Velcro straps come off
customer_reviews.text: I bought a pair of these for my boyfriend last year and ended up having to resew on the velcro straps on the side. I ended up ordering myself a pair a couple weeks ago not realizing it was the same brand. The velcro on the side has already come off on mine, meaning I'll have to resew it back on. I've used them twice. I hate sewing velcro. Ugh.
customer_reviews.author: Amber Waite

customer_reviews.title: Taking a chance on quality
customer_reviews.text: One pair Broke instantly. The cord on the told that tightens around the calf snapped the second I tried to tighten it- it was super brittle material. The other pair I bought were fine- but these aren't super high quality so you get what you pay for. But they do the trick and keep me dry and I like the colors!
customer_reviews.author: Tamara Carluccio

customer_reviews.title: Work great on boot our shoes with arched outter sole-- okay on hiking and regular shoes.
customer_reviews.text: This is my second pair. The Gaiters work greats on boots which has an arch on the outer sole--on hiking shoes and regular shoes where the outer sole is flat, multiple uses can cause the band to wear out, especially on gravel hike. I took it for a hike in the redwood forest and it kept debris from coming into my shoes really well. I also like the fact that it is waterproof. The size fit nicely, but can be a little tight on the boots. Will update once I take them to Alaska and will update pictures with worn out band.
customer_reviews.author: Hung Doan

customer_reviews.title: Needs a claps
customer_reviews.text: They just didn't hang on. The lower strap velcro would come loose and get muddy. After that they would no longer hang on. I think some kind of clasp would go a long way toward solving the problem.
customer_reviews.author: G & G

customer_reviews.title: Worked great walking the first section of the Kilimanjaro climb.
customer_reviews.text: I used these gaiters for a very wet, muddy, and sections of rocky conditions in a 16 kilometers walk to the Mandara Huts in Kilimanjaro. Worked perfectly and as described. They still look like new.
customer_reviews.author: Compulsive Explorer

customer_reviews.title: Cheap
customer_reviews.text: They are cheap but they are not waterproof enough for a day out in the snow. Also, the strap under your foot is connected with velcro, so if it opens in the snow, it is never going to close again. Order a size up. These were too small for me and I have size 6.5 feet.
customer_reviews.author: KS

customer_reviews.title: Put these over jeans and they were perfect! Extremely good price
customer_reviews.text: Just the thing for snow tubing! I had never been and did not want to buy expensive ski pants. Put these over jeans and they were perfect! Extremely good price. Kept snow our of my boots and off lower legs.
customer_reviews.author: Louise Barefoot

customer_reviews.title: My husband got these for his mountain trips to Mt ...
customer_reviews.text: My husband got these for his mountain trips to Mt Adams and Mt Hood. He said the boot opening was just a tad small for mountaineering boots, but they managed to stay on for both climbs, which were 12 hour days. Said they worked as advertised.
customer_reviews.author: Kristi Van

customer_reviews.title: Definitely something to consider.
customer_reviews.text: Pros: - Good at repelling water (Walked in tall grass with A LOT of morning condensation. Held up well, but wouldn't stand in water with them). - Actually fits comfortably (I'm 5 ft. so the "one size fits all" sizes do not fit well for me). - Very easily adjustable and does not slip down or off your leg. - Great coverage and protection. - Nice dark gray color. My only complaint is I wish it was just a little thicker. Other than that, it's a great product for the price!
customer_reviews.author: Tiffany Lam

customer_reviews.title: good, but plastic buckles break
customer_reviews.text: Reasonably priced, but the plastic buckles tend to break while you're out on the trail. A metal buckle would make this thing amazing, even if it cost an extra dollar or two.
customer_reviews.author: Peter Gaultney

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality product at surprising low price.
customer_reviews.text: You cannot beat this quality at this price! They lasted one year of extreme hiking. I've hiked hundreds of miles in the rocky mountains in these gaiters, I have no doubt they've lasted as long as gaiters that cost $100. Once these wear out I'm just buying another pair.
customer_reviews.author: Bowhunt3r4l1f3

customer_reviews.title: A hiker's must
customer_reviews.text: Crossed Florida swamps, wetlands and prairies with these. Excellent protection against ticks, thorny vines, horse fly attacks, mud splashing, you name it! My new favorite hiking gear.
customer_reviews.author: FL Boar

customer_reviews.title: Great product - we used lightly but they held up well.
customer_reviews.text: my son and I needed inexpensive gaitors for a trip to Jackson Hole - we live in the East and have never really needed them. These were priced right and worked great for our 2 hour snow-trek.
customer_reviews.author: hgpilot - MM

customer_reviews.title: I liked the metal clip for the laces
customer_reviews.text: Worked well on our first use. The strap under the shoe is not elastic as I read from other reviews. It is a strong, waterproofed material. I liked the metal clip for the laces. Perfect for my outing in the snow and kept my lower legs warm and dry.
customer_reviews.author: VT

customer_reviews.title: Excellent after many miles
customer_reviews.text: No complaints on these; we've gone through many miles of thick brush and cacti with them and they hold up well. We've also gone through mud and once it dries it kicks right off. foot strap holds up nicely and the color (teal) was bright and attractive. No need paying REI money for gaiters, these are excellent.
customer_reviews.author: jayoo

customer_reviews.title: These work really good when I am bear hunting in the rain or ...
customer_reviews.text: These work really good when I am bear hunting in the rain or snow. These things will cause my legs to sweat if it is a warmer day but on a cooler day my legs stay good and dry.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Boot strap to short
customer_reviews.text: I can only give it 2 stars due to the ridiculously short boot strap on the bottom....the strap is way to short! Hard to believe it’s that short. I have other gators and all there bottom straps are almost twice as long.
customer_reviews.author: Troy

customer_reviews.title: Worth the price, definitely.
customer_reviews.text: So much better than the old school gators that I had for 40 years. I don't know how they work in snow as the snow had melted by the time I wore them, but so much easier to put on than those old ones. Kept sticks and rocks out of my shoes, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Tikay

customer_reviews.title: Little accessory, big difference to comfort in wet golf conditions
customer_reviews.text: This is amazing ... to be able to keep my trousers bottom clean while golfing in the wet conditions. I think they look sharp and they definitely do the job keeping my clothes dry. I take a little teasing due to the colour. They wipe off easily and are super easy to put on, take off. As I love to golf in any kind of weather, except snow ... these are "fit for purpose".
customer_reviews.author: Paul B.

customer_reviews.title: Loved them. I have muscluar calves so the adjustability ...
customer_reviews.text: I wore these in Spain for the Camino trail with a pancho. Packs light and more convenient than pants. Loved them. I have muscluar calves so the adjustability was a plus! Stays on very well!
customer_reviews.author: Elle Chupacabra

customer_reviews.title: The size doesn't correspond to the correct size. The ...
customer_reviews.text: The size doesn't correspond to the correct size. The M size comes small. And can't use. Additional I have not solution, Just to send the product back, but I'm not in USA I'm in the South America jungle. It's no logic, I will spend at about of 25usd to send it back. For a 15usd refund... For that I lost my money. M SIZE is my size but in this case doesn't fit me. :(
customer_reviews.author: Javier

customer_reviews.title: Great for winter hunting.
customer_reviews.text: If you don't like wearing heavy winter boots this is the ticket. Keeps you legs dry and snow out of your boots. Well constructed and holds up very good.
customer_reviews.author: OG BonecollectorTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Don't hold up well in mud
customer_reviews.text: These don't hold up in mud. The Velcro fastenings can become clogged with mud and don't close. They can be a poor fit relative to other designs, these left the laces of my boots exposed because of the design. They aren't breathable and so your feet can get quite hot wearing these. That said, they are made of durable waterproof fabric and brightly colored, they may be ok for very light use, but I regret buying these and threw them away at the end of my hike.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great as tick shields .
customer_reviews.text: I use these gators as tick shields. They work great. Keeps the ticks on the outside, where you can spot them and kill them before they crawl up your legs to bite you. Wash them in a washing machine and they are good to go once again.
customer_reviews.author: W. Grooms

customer_reviews.title: Cute, Great Fit, just what you need for an amazing price!
customer_reviews.text: I bought them in size M, and i'm usually a US size M/S with medium calf size. fits as expected! I like the blue ones because they look super cute while wearing black leggings. I went snowshoeing with these and they kept me warm and dry
customer_reviews.author: Jasmina Davis

customer_reviews.title: fit is too small
customer_reviews.text: I was disappointed when I tried these on as they were so tight in the calf area that I had a hard time fitting them over jeans, and was completely unable to fit them over rain boots. My calf size is 16 so I will be searching for different style that will fit over boots, both rain and snow.
customer_reviews.author: Sharon Liska

customer_reviews.title: Used it for Mt. Fuji climb.
customer_reviews.text: My wife used it when we were coming down from Mt. Fuji in Japan. The return trail was full of gravel and sand but the product protected her low cut hiking shoes from them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Recommend ordering a LARGE or extra LARGE to get better ...
customer_reviews.text: after ordering this product one size small, I decided to return it and order the next size. Still does not fit. Recommend ordering a LARGE or extra LARGE to get better fitment.
customer_reviews.author: Carl Boler

customer_reviews.title: They were an excellent deal for the money
customer_reviews.text: I have used these while winter hiking, cross country skiing, and while biking in the winter. They were an excellent deal for the money. I can't tell if they will last as the strap seems like it is a weak point. But so far one winter's worth of use and they are fine.
customer_reviews.author: DL

customer_reviews.title: The price point on these is great and so far they’ve held up very well
customer_reviews.text: The price point on these is great and so far they’ve held up very well. I’ve used them quite a few times and they’ve kept snow out of my shoes/pants and mud off my hiking pants. I highly recommend them. I ended up ordering a M (figured I would have gotten a S), but this size works great over snow pants or regular hiking pants.
customer_reviews.author: K

customer_reviews.title: They kept me dry and fit pretty well, especially when I was descending and posting ...
customer_reviews.text: I had ordered these gaters before an alpine camping trip in the Sierras a month ago. My hike included a 3 mile climb and descent through deep snow with several creek crossings. They kept me dry and fit pretty well, especially when I was descending and posting into the snow for stability. For the price, you can't beat the performance of the product. I'd buy these again for sure. -John
customer_reviews.author: pomotrash

customer_reviews.title: Worked as well as the $65 gaiters you buy at ...
customer_reviews.text: Worked as well as the $65 gaiters you buy at REI. Cheap isn't always an indicator of quality. Pants stayed dry through water and snow.
customer_reviews.author: JC

customer_reviews.title: I like these BUT the strap tore before I even started ...
customer_reviews.text: I like these BUT the strap tore before I even started using them. I had no choice but to use them because I was on the mountain already and there was lots of snow. They did keep me dry but they would not tighten enough so I am returning and reordering because they are worth another shot.
customer_reviews.author: Angie

customer_reviews.title: No complaints
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I use them fast biking, they have a nice slim fit that keeps both them and my shoe laces from getting caught in the chainring. The Velcro holds tight and the stirrups have proven durable. Excellent purchase for a great price!
customer_reviews.author: Ben Nielsen

customer_reviews.title: havent tried it out yet, but I tried it ...
customer_reviews.text: havent tried it out yet, but I tried it on. Should mention to everyone to measure WITH the pants and boots you plan on wearing it with as it changes the measurements. Will update review when I try it
customer_reviews.author: Northwest

customer_reviews.title: Love these gaiters
customer_reviews.text: Love these gaiters! I wore these when climbing the Mt St Helens. There was plenty of snow at the time. I felt really good plowing through the snow without getting wet.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: These were perfect
customer_reviews.text: Easy to put on and keeps out most of the snow. I recently went snow shoeing and was knee deep in it and these did a great job keeping the snow out. Light weight and fold-able, makes for stowing a way simple and didn't take up much space in my pack. All in all pretty pleased with these.
customer_reviews.author: Mperez

customer_reviews.title: Good Construction/Materials. Size (purchased Large) was a just a ...
customer_reviews.text: Good Construction/Materials. Size (purchased Large) was a just a tiny bit smaller than described, and the sole strap is too short for my big boots - but is easily fixed since it's a basic velcro strap.
customer_reviews.author: Marc Haworth

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: For the money these are awesome! I've been looking at several of these at REI and decided to take a chance on this less expensive option just for kicks. Super impressed with how well they keep snow out of my boots and off my legs. Went hiking the day I got them to try 'em out, and they kept me high and dry, and in the pic I'm in the "shallow" part of the trail.
customer_reviews.author: Joe Christensen

customer_reviews.title: "Go Gators!"...
customer_reviews.text: These gaiters are great, hiked in them yesterday. NOTE TO SELLER: I was issued 2 LEFT legs. The logos face the SAME direction, instead of facing left and right (like my husband's pair does). I'd really like to have a RIGHT leg, too!
customer_reviews.author: Kate

customer_reviews.title: Great gaiters for snowshoeing & more
customer_reviews.text: I only used them once, but they worked very well. I stayed dry and they fit well. (I wear ladies shoe size 8.5 and bought size medium).
customer_reviews.author: Happy Customer

customer_reviews.title: Makes yard work less painful
customer_reviews.text: I wear these when I use my weed trimmer. After years of having my shins turned into a bloody mess by using a weed trimmer while wearing shorts I bought these. They are thick enough to deflect most of the garbage shot into my shins by trimmer. They are easily removed when I'm done trimming. My yard work became a lot less painful.
customer_reviews.author: Ti Rider

customer_reviews.title: I wish I had bought them in black rather than blue
customer_reviews.text: They did a good job, although I wish I had bought them in black rather than blue. Brightly colored gaiters look weird. I had to ask people to take photos of me avoiding to have the gaiters showing up.
customer_reviews.author: AB

customer_reviews.title: Weak Velcro
customer_reviews.text: The quality is okay enough, but the velcro stirrup is very weak and we had to reattach the stirrup several times in a 8 mile trek. They are stylish and well constructed, so it’s a shame.
customer_reviews.author: Branden McNew

customer_reviews.title: Way too small, even when we followed sizing instructions
customer_reviews.text: We ordered a pair for my daughter and when they arrived they were too small. We made sure to read the sizing instructions and carefully measure before reordering and the second pair was also too small. We won't be reordering.
customer_reviews.author: Tusanella33

customer_reviews.title: work great, sturdy & seems like they will last many ...
customer_reviews.text: Wore several times, work great, sturdy & seems like they will last many seasons. You can see why so many have sold-great product & price point
customer_reviews.author: landy w.

customer_reviews.title: Alright
customer_reviews.text: Eh they were eh not the best but not terrible. Honest I never worry because they fitted terrible. Fit my dad though
customer_reviews.author: Ryan M

customer_reviews.title: Needs duct tape - size up for bulky hiking boots
customer_reviews.text: I wear everything in small but their S was not made for bulky mountaineering hiking boots (or maybe size up) but does the job with duct tape as others have suggested. Velco strap that goes under the shoe was also on the short side. Velco around the leg allows for only one diameter so not adjustable in width. Fabric is good quality but it'd be a superior product is the base was wider and the bottom strap longer.
customer_reviews.author: Maple

customer_reviews.title: Don't waste your money or time on these.
customer_reviews.text: The velcro is terrible. The fabric is paper-thin. The stitching is beyond bad. The arch-strap is surprisingly good...but that's like putting frosting on a turd; doesn't mean you'd want to take a bite!
customer_reviews.author: Dave Rentz

customer_reviews.title: Fit well, keep me dry
customer_reviews.text: These are great, exactly what gaiters need to be. They fit well, clip onto my boots, keep the snow, mud, and puddle splashes off my inner layers. Great addition to my outdoor gear! The velcro is sturdy, they tighten up well at the top and pull clear down over the laces of my boots.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. V

product_meta.title: OUTAD Waterproof Outdoor Hiking Walking Climbing Hunting Snow Legging Gaiters(1 Pair)
product_meta.description:
These gaiters are good for hiking, walking, backpacking and skiing. They are made of durable waterproof materials to sustain harsh weather. Pair these gaiters with hiking boots or ski boots to keep rocks, dirt and snow from getting into your footwear. 

Specifications 
Detailed Dimensions: 
Bottom opening circumference x Ankle circumference x Top opening circumference 
S: 14.6 x 12.6 x 15.4 inches / 37 x 32 x 39 cm 
M: 15 x 13.8 x 15.7 inches / 41 x 35 x 42 cm 
L: 16.9 x 15.4 x 16.5 inches / 43 x 39 x 42 cm 
Color: Dark gray; Light green; Sky blue;Orange 
Package size: 44 x 25 x 1 cm 
Material: 600D oxford fabric 
Weight: 250g 

Package Includes 
1 Pair of OUTAD Gaiters
feature_bullets: ★Waterproof breathable nylon fabric. Excellent waterproof: 6000mm, snow proof
★600d oxford fabric: Durable material, tear resistant, breathable
★Metal hook at the bottom to fasten to shoe lace£¬strong stereo sense, firm to wear

specifications.Customer Reviews: /** Fix for UDP-1061. Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
